citation.article-title: Shinella daejeonensis sp. nov., a nitrate-reducing bacterium isolated from sludge of a leachate treatment plant
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Shinella daejeonensis sp. nov.
Shinella daejeonensis (da.e.je.o.nen′sis. N.L. fem. adj. daejeonensis pertaining to Daejeon, a city in South Korea, from where the type strain was isolated).
Cells are Gram-negative-staining, aerobic, motile, non-spore-forming rods.
Grows at pH 6.0–9.0, with optimum growth at pH 7.0.
Growth occurs on NA, R2A agar, TSA, LB agar and MacConkey agar.
Aesculin, casein, chitin, HE-cellulose, starch, xylan and DNA are not hydrolysed.

In API ID 32 GN, API 20NE and API 50 CH tests, acetate, N-acetylglucosamine, d-adonitol, l-alanine, l-arabinose, d-arabitol, l-fucose, d-galactose, gluconate (weakly), d-glucose, glycerol, inositol, lactose, d-lyxose, malate (weakly), maltose, d-mannitol, d-mannose, l-proline, l-rhamnose, d-ribose, l-serine, d-sorbitol, sucrose, trehalose, turanose, xylitol and d-xylose are utilized for growth, but adipate, aesculin, amygdalin, d-arabinose, l-arabitol, arbutin, caprate, cellobiose, citrate, dulcitol, erythritol, d-fructose, d-fucose, gentiobiose, glycogen, l-histidine, 3-hydroxybenzoate, 4-hydroxybenzoate, dl-3-hydroxybutyrate, inulin, itaconate, 2-ketogluconate, 5-ketogluconate, lactate, malonate, melezitose, melibiose, methyl α-d-glucopyranoside, methyl α-d-mannopyranoside, methyl β-d-xylopyranoside, phenylacetate, propionate, raffinose, salicin, l-sorbose, starch, suberate, d-tagatose, valerate and l-xylose are not utilized.

In API ZYM and API 20E tests, positive for esterase (C4), β-galactosidase, gelatinase, α-glucosidase, leucine arylamidase, lipase esterase (C8) and trypsin, but negative for acid phosphatase, N-acetyl-β-glucosaminidase, alkaline phosphatase, arginine dihydrolase, α-chymotrypsin, cystine arylamidase, α-fucosidase, α-galactosidase, β-glucuronidase, β-glucosidase, lipase (C14), lysine decarboxylase, α-mannosidase, naphthol-AS-BI-phosphohydrolase, ornithine decarboxylase, tryptophan deaminase, urease and valine arylamidase.
In API 20E tests, acid is produced from l-arabinose but not from amygdalin, d-glucose, inositol, d-mannitol, melibiose, l-rhamnose, d-sorbitol or sucrose; production of H2S and indole are negative.
Ubiquinone Q-10 is the predominant respiratory lipoquinone and C18 : 1ω7c and C16 : 0 are the major cellular fatty acids.
The type strain, MJ02T ( = KCTC 22450T = JCM 16236T), was isolated from sludge of the aerobic treatment tanks of a municipal leachate treatment plant located in Daejeon, South Korea.
The DNA G+C content of the type strain is 64.3 mol%.
